message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper discusses the problem of chunking, which is a common task in natural language processing. The paper specifically focuses on the representation of data for recognizing noun phrase chunks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing. The paper also uses memory-based learning, which falls under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper discusses the performance of different data representations, which is a common topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The problem of information retrieval (cs.IR) is also mentioned as a potential application of chunking. Finally, the paper uses a standard data set, which is a common practice in neural networks (cs.NE).
